sub_topic: Determining the length of a side in an isosceles triangle.
message_1: In an isosceles triangle, the length of each of the two congruent sides is 9 cm. If the length of the base is 12 cm, what is the length of each of the other two sides?
message_2: In an isosceles triangle, the two congruent sides have equal length. Since the problem states that the length of each of the two congruent sides is 9 cm, the length of each of the other two sides is 9 cm.
